entry.title: I Want to show you something
entry.quote: Prowling around the empty nighttime suburbs with headphones on, trying to figure out if this tree in someone’s yard is a chestnut (no, chinquapin), I hear a man’s voice across the street behind me: M’AM. M’AM. M’AM!!!

entry.title: Good Intentions, Bad Inventions:The Four Myths of Healthy Tech
entry.quote: The tech companies that design and build so many of the devices, platforms, and software we use for hours each day have embraced myths that push a flawed understanding of digital well-being.

entry.title: How The URL Was Built
entry.quote: The Web was invented as a solution to the problem of passing around information between computers. Although this was possible before the Web, the absence of a uniform format and protocol made the whole process cumbersome.

entry.title: When Data visualization and Art Collide With the Humble Org Chart
entry.quote: There’s a widespread belief that companies which are successful in digital achieve their goals because they have the right internal structures in place. I am intrigued by how you can visualize these structures beyond simple org charts, and whether or not a tangible representation of them reveals insights into the way a company is managed.
